snippet: A regional auction to buy power for 2017 and 2018 in so-called capacity markets ended with a shortfall in megawatts, ISO-New England said.
abstract: ISO-New England electric grid operator says retirement of several power plants in New England is reducing power supply and driving up prices; says regional auction to buy power for 2017 and 2018 in so-called capacity markets ends with shortfall in megawatts.
lead_paragraph: A regional auction to buy power for 2017 and 2018 in so-called capacity markets ended with a shortfall in megawatts, ISO-New England said.

headline.main: Closed Plants Crimp Supply of Power in New England
headline.print_headline: Closed Plants Crimp Supply of Power in New England
